item.title: Contributing
item.description: Contributing # Currently there is only one very small deck for learning German minimal pairs. Have a look at the repository and consider contributing.

item.title: Credits
item.description: Credits # Gentium font for IPA text (https://software.sil.org/gentium/) Ultimate Geography for the basis of the card templates (https://github.com/anki-geo/ultimate-geography) Logo free with attribution from flaticon.com

item.title: Inspiration & Resources
item.description: Inspiration & Resources # Projects, ideas and resources that influenced the creation of this project and that may come in handy. forvo.com download audio in multiple languages Ultimate Geography, a fantastic Anki deck that successfully demonstrates how to collaborate on multiple Anki decks 625 words from Gabriel Wyner’s Fluent Forever The “Fluent Forever” book by Gabriel Wyner Xefjord’s language decks Antimoon, with many valuable resources, for example why it’s important to prioritize pronunciation

item.title: Roadmap
item.description: Roadmap # A rough sketch where this could be going. Allow learning from many language to many other languages (e.g. enable a native French speaker to learn Swahili) Create minimal pair decks to learn pronunciation Create language specific IPA (International Phonetic Alphabet) decks for learning what the IPA symbols mean and what sounds they encode to enable learners to efficiently use a dictionary Create decks for learning the 625 basic words in any language Create cards for learning vocabulary and grammatical structures according to levels (e.
